intro: Elatostema gyronanophyllum, commonly known as the silverleaf elatostema, is a herbaceous plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes nettle plants, and is characterized by its small, opposite leaves. The leaves are typically covered in fine, silvery hairs, giving the plant its common name. It produces small greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments. This species is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to temperate climates.
